label: Swampland Distance Conjecture
mathematical_goal: Verify that PM satisfies the Swampland Distance Conjecture for consistent quantum gravity
theoretical_significance: The Swampland Distance Conjecture states that in any consistent quantum gravity theory, scalar field excursions must be bounded: Delta_phi/M_Pl < O(1), with a precise bound a >= 1/sqrt(d-2). For d=7 (G2 manifold), a >= 0.447. PM satisfies this with a = 1/sqrt(5) ~ 0.447, ensuring consistency with string theory constraints. This is not imposed but follows from G2 geometry.
